author: Albert Bassili
title: One of my favorite 4th of July deals is a big discount on a Keurig
description: If you love coffee but don't have enough space for a big coffee maker, this 4th of July deal on the Keurig K-Mini is worth snatching up before it's over.

author: Saskia Kemsley
title: Best vacuum insulated flasks to keep your drinks hot
description: Keep your coffee hot hot

author: Lily O'Neill
title: Two friends open all-day taco shop in Five Points
description: Head to the to-go window early for some coffee and breakfast tacos, like the Early Bird Taco with breaded, buttermilk fried chicken, scrambled eggs and chorizo gravy.

author: Haley Strack
title: Veteran Couple Use Coffee to Continue Serving
description: Mike and Kelly Donaldson opened Yellow Bird Coffee House in Springfield, Ill., after spending a combined 48 years in the military.

author: Vishwam Sankaran
title: Drinking coffee gives ‘special’ boost to the brain beyond its caffeine content, study finds
description: While caffeinated drinks may have some effects, scientists say there are special benefits from coffee drinking

title: Man arrested after crashing car into Melbourne business
description: A man travelling in an allegedly stolen car has ploughed through a coffee shop overnight in Melbourne's north-east.

author: NEAT PLACES
title: Where to find coffee that packs a punch in Christchurch
description: The coffee roasters scene is understated, distinct and worthy of getting to know the players and roasts.

author: Katharina Buczek
title: PSA: To Save Yourself Time, Money, And Disappointment, Your First Date Should Just Be A 30-Minute Coffee Date
description: The following column is the opinion and analysis of the writer, Katharina Buczek. Picture this: you meet a new guy online, and everything seems wonderful when you’re both behind screens. You find their dating app photos attractive, and the conversation just keeps flowing. So, you two decide to take the plunge and go out to […]

author: Emily Lefroy
title: Why that morning jolt from coffee is not just the caffeine
description: There may be another reason why java consumers get a pep in their step.

author: Leah Bitsky
title: Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie’s kids Pax, Zahara, Shiloh and Knox enjoy rare outing
description: Siblings Pax, 19, Zahara, 18, Shiloh, 17, and Knox, 14, were seen spending quality time together as they popped into LA's Maru Coffee for some beverages.

author: Zeina Jaafar
title: Dearborn-based Arab American-owned businesses expand their services into Canton
description: CANTON — Dearborn-based Arab American-owned business are continuing to spread into surrounding Metro Detroit cities. The Papaya Supermarket and Qahwah House coffee shop have made their way into Canton in recent months. Canton Township’s supervisor, Anne Marie Graham-Hudak, told The Arab American News that these new businesses add an additional cultural ambiance and service to […]The post Dearborn-based Arab American-owned businesses expand their services into Canton appeared first on ArabAmericanNews.

author: Angharad Brewer Gillham, Frontiers Science News
title: That Essential Morning Coffee May Be a Placebo
description: Scientists testing coffee against plain caffeine found that plain caffeine only partially reproduces the effects of drinking a cup of coffee, activating areas of the brain that make you feel more alert but not the areas of the brain that affect working memory and goal-directed behavior.Read more...

author: Sydney Morton
title: Okanagan cat cafe approves multiple adoptions in first week
description: Not only is Catelowna Cat Cafe a place where coffee is served with a side of kitten cuddles; every cat in the room is available for adoption.

author: JONNY MAHON-HEAP
title: Barbie v Oppenheimer: Together they are Barbenheimer and fans are debating the best way to enjoy them both
description: The order needs to be: black coffee and a cigarette, Oppenheimer around 11 (it's 3 hours) mimosas and brunch, Barbie around 6/7, dinner, drinks, club.

author: Andrea Grajeda
title: Sundays at Spruce event brings coffee, live music
description: Summer Sundays on Pearl Street offer espresso, both the coffee and the swing band.

author: Aric Sleeper
title: Westside’s Cruz Foam launches new eco-friendly packaging products
description: Cruz Foam, with facilities on the Westside of Santa Cruz, has recently launched two new packaging products, made in part from the shells of sea creatures such as shrimp, to keep products such as cold brews cool and wine bottles intact while they ship out to customers. Local companies Verve Coffee and Real Good Fish are early adopters of the eco-friendly packaging products.

author: Paula Tran
title: Banff’s new single-use waste reduction bylaw to take effect Saturday
description: Starting Saturday, the bylaw will require businesses like coffee shops and restaurants to serve food and drinks without disposable accessories (straws, utensils, cup lids, etc.).
